casebody.data:
PETROLEUM HEAT & POWER COMPANY, Plaintiff in Error, v. Francis H. BROWN, Defendant in Error. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. May 2, 1927. No. 308. Chadbourne, Stanchfield & Levy, of New York City (William Wallace, Jr., J. Arthur Leve and Harold A. Callan, all of New York City, of counsel), for plaintiff in error. Everett, Clarke & Benedict, of New York City (Herman S. Hertwig and J. Maxwell Fassett, both of New York City, and George S. Wolbert, of Philadelphia, Pa., of counsel), for defendant in error.

Before MANTON and SWAN, Circuit Judges, and CAMPBELL, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed, with costs.
